response.original_title: はざま -母語のための場をさがして-
response.overview: Immigrant children in Japan must find alternative ways to stay in touch with their mother tongue as the country becomes home to approximately 3.41 million foreign residents. Teachers of all kinds run language classes operated on necessity as families learn to navigate children with varying levels of skill with what should come naturally to them. Visa issues and status of residence loom over it all.
response.title: はざま -母語のための場をさがして-
